snippet: An advocacy group is trying to convince Korean parents in Queens that if there is something unusual about their child, concealing it and avoiding help are absolutely the wrong things to do.
abstract: Autism Speaks, leading advocacy group, is teaming with churches, doctors, schools and news organizations in Queens to coax Korean-American parents to seek proper medical help and social support when a child appears to have, or is diagnosed with, autism;  Korean culture places a stigma on families with autistic children, and recent study found unexpectedly high prevalence of autism in South Korean children.
lead_paragraph: An advocacy group is trying to convince Korean parents in Queens that if there is something unusual about their child, concealing it and avoiding help are absolutely the wrong things to do.

headline.main: Working to Combat the Stigma of Autism
headline.print_headline: Working to Combat The Stigma of Autism
